dt: {bc}one who assumes the financial responsibilities of a sporting event (such as a boxing match) including contracting with the principals, renting the site, and collecting gate receipts
{bc}a substance that in very small amounts is able to increase the activity of a catalyst
{bc}a binding site in a DNA chain at which RNA polymerase binds to initiate transcription of messenger RNA by one or more nearby structural genes

shortdef: one that promotes; especially : one who assumes the financial responsibilities of a sporting event (such as a boxing match) including contracting with the principals, renting the site, and collecting gate receipts
a substance that in very small amounts is able to increase the activity of a catalyst

dt.t: Leonard is a "crossover icon"—a term {wi}copromoter{/wi} Bernie Dillon uses to describe Leonard's broad appeal in and out of boxing …

shortdef: one of two or more joint promoters

dt: {bc}the act of furthering one's own growth, advancement, or prosperity {bc}the {d_link|promotion|promotion} of oneself

utxt.t: a {wi}self-promoter{/wi} who never mentioned his teammates in interviews
They both worked tirelessly on the project and never thought about bringing attention to themselves. They weren't {wi}self-promoters{/wi} …

shortdef: the act of furthering one's own growth, advancement, or prosperity : the promotion of oneself
